message.content:
cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL 

The paper discusses content-based video retrieval (CBVR), which involves analyzing the visual and audio streams of videos to enable search without relying on text metadata. This topic falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) and computer vision (cs.CV) sub-categories. The paper also discusses low-level feature design, feature fusion, semantic detector training, and video search/reranking, which are related to information retrieval (cs.IR), machine learning (cs.LG), and natural language processing (cs.CL). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.MM and cs.CV, followed by cs.IR, cs.LG, and cs.CL.
